intro: Trochocephalus alpestris, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its habitat, it is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
